intro: Macaranga myriolepida, commonly known as the giant mallow, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance. The flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers present on the same plant.
